intro: Sinocrassula jiaozishanensis, commonly known as the Jiaozishan stonecress, is a rare and unique succulent native to China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that are typically green or bluish-green in color. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive in dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
